title: The Dentists Act 1984 (Medical Authorities) Order 2025
summary: This law designates the University of Portsmouth as an official authority to run dentistry exams and issue practice licences. Graduates passing these exams can now be registered with the General Dental Council, ensuring more dentists can legally qualify through this university. By adding a new pathway for licensing, the move may increase access to dental care by streamlining training and certification at this institution.

title: The National Health Service (General Medical Services Contracts) (Prescription of Drugs etc.) (Amendment) Regulations 2025
The Personal Injuries (NHS Charges) (Amounts) (Amendment) Regulations 2025
summary: Starting 1 October 2025, insurers paying compensation for accidents will reimburse the NHS higher fees for treating injuries: £267 for ambulance use (up from £256), £883 for non-admitted hospital treatment (up from £848), £1,085 per day for hospital stays (up from £1,042), and a maximum charge of £64,856 per injury (up from £62,272). This directly increases the NHS’s recovery of costs from liable parties, boosting funding for frontline services without changing patient care or out-of-pocket costs for the public.

title: The Designation of Schools Having a Religious Character (Independent Schools) (England) Order 2025
The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Bristol) Regulations 2025
The Aldwark Bridge (Revision of Tolls and Traffic Classification) Order 2025
summary: This law sets new limits on how much drivers must pay to cross Aldwark Bridge, changing both the maximum toll amounts and which vehicles (like cars, vans, or lorries) get charged. It replaces the old 2005 pricing rules, meaning drivers could pay more or less depending on their vehicle type, giving the bridge operators updated authority to manage toll income based on current needs.

title: The Designation of Schools Having a Religious Character (England) Order 2025
The Power to Award Degrees etc. (The Liverpool Institute for Performing Arts) Order 2025
summary: The Order allows the Liverpool Institute for Performing Arts to legally grant taught undergraduate degrees for four years from 15 September 2025, ensuring students completing eligible programs can formally receive recognized qualifications through the institute during this period without expanding broader degree-giving powers or disrupting existing public-sector education systems.

title: The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Tulliallan) Regulations 2025
The Yorkshire Water Services Limited (River Ouse, Moor Monkton) Drought Order 2025
The Social Fund Winter Fuel Payment Regulations 2025
The Wireless Telegraphy (Licence Charges for the 900 MHz Frequency Band and the 1800 MHz Frequency Band) Regulations 2025
The Viking CCS Carbon Dioxide Pipeline (Correction) Order 2025
The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Brook Hotel, Bowthorpe) Regulations 2025
The Diocese of Chichester (Educational Endowments) (Mountfield and Whatlington Church of England Primary School) Order 2025
The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Bowthorpe) (Emergency) (Revocation) Regulations 2025
The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Hoyland, Barnsley) (Emergency) (Revocation) Regulations 2025
The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Turnberry, Scotland) Regulations 2025
The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Prestwick, Scotland) Regulations 2025
The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Carnell Estate, Scotland) Regulations 2025
The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Royal Air Force Brize Norton) Regulations 2025
The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Craven Park, Hull) Regulations 2025
The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Alrewas) Regulations 2025
The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Hampton Court Palace) Regulations 2025
The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Blenheim Palace) Regulations 2025
The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Bowthorpe) (Emergency) Regulations 2025
The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Nuneaton, Warwickshire) (Emergency) Regulations 2025
The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Chipping Norton) Regulations 2025
The Health and Social Care Information Standards (Procedure) Regulations 2025
The Alcoholic Products (Repayment Interest Rate) (Alcohol Duty) Regulations 2025
summary: These regulations set a new interest rate for repayments owed by HMRC in alcohol duty cases, directly linked to the Bank of England’s official rate. If the official rate falls below 0.5%, HMRC will still pay at least that minimum, ensuring businesses or individuals handling alcohol taxes receive predictable compensation. Rate changes will apply retroactively to ongoing debts, protecting recipients from losing out if interest drops. This ensures fairer returns for those claiming overpaid taxes and aligns HMRC’s payments with broader financial trends, affecting cash flow for breweries, distillers, or importers.

title: The Finance Act 2009 (Section 101) (Alcohol Duty) (Appointed Day) Order 2025
The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Sevenoaks) Regulations 2025
The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Saltby) Regulations 2025
The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Tenby) Regulations 2025
The Power to Award Degrees etc. (TEC Partnership) (Amendment) Order 2025
summary: This law removes the expiration date on TEC Partnership’s authority to award bachelor’s degrees and lets it delegate that power to other institutions. Previously time-limited, its ability to grant degrees up to bachelor’s level is now permanent, and it can expand partnerships—like accrediting colleges or universities—to offer such qualifications under its name. This opens opportunities for new educational collaborations and degree programs.

title: The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Manston) (Revocation) Regulations 2025
The Electricity and Gas (Energy Company Obligation) (Amendment) Order 2025
The Byers Gill Solar Order 2025
summary: This law allows a solar power plant and battery storage facility to be built, operated, and maintained on specified land, including the right to seize private land through compulsory purchase if needed. It also lets developers override existing land rights (like usage agreements) to ensure the project proceeds. The move aims to boost renewable energy generation, helping cut carbon emissions and potentially reducing reliance on fossil fuels. Residents can freely review detailed plans at local council offices to understand the project’s scope and impact.

title: The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Nottingham Goose Fair) Regulations 2025
The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Blackpool) (No. 2) Regulations 2025
The Power to Award Degrees etc. (Northern School of Contemporary Dance) Order 2025
The Skills and Post-16 Education Act 2022 (Commencement No. 3) (England) Regulations 2025
The Environment Agency (Holme Styes Reservoir) Drought Order 2025
The Power to Award Degrees etc. (School-Led Development Trust) Order 2025
summary: Starting August 1, 2025, The National Institute of Teaching can issue specific taught degrees for four years, allowing them to provide accredited teacher training programs without changing any existing duties for schools, businesses, or public services.

title: The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Cutcombe Hill, Somerset) (Emergency) (Revocation) Regulations 2025
The Online Safety Super-Complaints (Eligibility and Procedural Matters) Regulations 2025
summary: These rules explain which organizations can officially report serious online safety concerns to OFCOM under the Online Safety Act. To qualify as an eligible entity, groups must meet specific criteria (like being a recognized consumer or safety watchdog) and provide evidence to back their status. If OFCOM doesn’t approve their eligibility, the complaint is automatically rejected. When filing, groups must include all required details and can’t resubmit within six months unless exceptional circumstances apply. OFCOM can dismiss complaints if they lack necessary info or repeat prior issues. The process aims to ensure only credible, well-prepared concerns get reviewed, streamlining oversight of online safety without overburdening regulators. No major impacts on businesses or the public are anticipated, as the focus is on equipping OFCOM to target systemic risks.

title: The Transport Act 2000 (Air Traffic Services) (Prescribed Terms) Regulations 2025
summary: This law change gives the UK government more flexibility to adjust the licenses of air traffic service providers—like NATS, which manages high-altitude flights—by updating the types of services they offer and the regions they cover. The tweak follows a push to modernize how airspace is designed, allowing the government to task NATS with proposing improvements (such as more efficient flight paths) and the Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) to approve them. While the reform is procedural, it could lead to smoother airspace management over time, potentially benefiting airlines, airports, and travelers through reduced delays or operational costs. However, officials say the immediate economic impact will be small, with annual costs for businesses staying under £10 million, so no detailed analysis was required.

title: The Electricity Capacity (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2025
summary: These new rules update the UK's Electricity Capacity Regulations to let power providers end their existing agreements without penalties if they want to switch to government-backed contracts for carbon capture projects. The change ensures companies investing in cleaner energy tech aren’t stuck in old deals, but they’ll need to plan ahead: terminations only take effect years later to avoid disrupting the power supply. It also sets out how providers can appeal if their switch gets rejected and clarifies financial protections like releasing held deposits. Designed to smooth transitions into carbon capture initiatives, this tweak aims to support greener energy projects while keeping the grid stable, likely speeding up the UK’s shift away from polluting power sources with minimal disruption to businesses already in the system.

title: The Legislative Reform (Disclosure of Adult Social Care Data) Order 2025
summary: This legislation updates rules to let the UK government and Welsh authorities share matched data about adult social care services with local councils in both England and Wales. Previously, strict limits on sharing this information made it harder to spot mistakes or fraud in payments for support like home care, nursing homes, or disability assistance. By scrapping these rules, councils can now cross-check data—such as who’s receiving care and what they’re being charged—to recover misused funds, fix billing errors, and ensure services are run fairly. The change aims to cut costs for local authorities by reducing losses from fraudulent claims or administrative slip-ups and streamline processes by removing outdated paperwork hurdles. Any money saved could free up resources for councils to reinvest in social care improvements or other community needs, while stronger data collaboration might lead to quicker identification of ineligible claims or service gaps in vulnerable populations.

title: The Air Navigation (Restriction of Flying) (Epping) (Emergency) (No. 2) Regulations 2025
